doc.title: Focus: Mutual Fund Positioning / Performance
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/EM Weekly Fund Flows Monitor FII selling this week led by India China saw record hedge funds buying MTD MFs added India _2025-08-29

passages.text: EM Asia ex- China markets saw FII selling of US\\$2.4bn w/w, led by India (US\\$0.8bn) and Korea (US\\$0.7bn). Taiwan (US\\$0.5bn) and ASEAN (US\\$0.4bn) also saw outflows w/w. Non- Asia EMs saw selling of US\\$560mn wow, led by South Africa (US\\$660mn).

Southbound saw moderate inflows of US\\$2.8bn this week (Ytd: +US\\$126bn). Thailand and Taiwan saw retail buying of US\\$0.2bn and US\\$0.1bn respectively. Korea saw muted selling w/w. Ytd, Asian markets have seen US\\$16bn retail inflows.

Global flows: Equity funds globally saw inflows of US\\$16bn wow (vs. US\\$3bn inflows last week). In DM, US saw buying of US\\$\\$16bn. Europe (US\\$1.2bn) and Japan (US\\$0.9bn) funds saw selling w/w.
EM: GEM funds saw muted inflows w/w (+US\\$17mn).

Hedge Fund (HF) flows: According to Prime Services, HF flows into Asia continued to be risk on for a fourth consecutive month on a gross basis. China saw record flows MTD with the allocations rising sharply (Net allocations +180bps at 8.6%, 56th %- ile). Taiwan saw moderate buying MTD, while Korea flows were flat.

Mutual Fund (MF) positioning: JULY EPFR data, active EM funds are most OW LAM markets - Brazil (+275bp) & Mexico (+75bp) vs. Benchmark weights, and most UAA China, India (- 80bp Uw each). Over the past month, EM funds have fased exposure to India but trimmed in Brazil. Our largest 350 EM & Asian funds sample continued to reach fresh ytd highs with 20- 22% returns on average ytd, while China funds rose 17% ytd. \(\sim 90\%\) of Asian/EM funds outperformed the benchmark in Aug MTD.

FTSE Rebalance (Sep 2025): FTSE announced the indicative semi- annual review results for its Global Equity Index Series (GEIS), with changes subject to revision until Sep 5. Rebalancing is expected to trigger over US\\$12 billion in gross two- way flows and US\\$1.3 billion in net inflows across APAC/EM markets.
Exhibit 1: According to Prime Services, flows into Asia continued to be risk on for a fourth consecutive month on a gross basis, led by China.

Exhibit 2: Chinese equities saw record net flows MTD with continued risk on activity. Long buys dominated the flows. A- shares led both net and gross activity. H- shares and ADRs saw net inflows led by short covers.
Exhibit 3: Gross allocation to China increased 76 bps MTD to \(6.4\%\) (64th percentile 5- year) approaching 2- year highs
